Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy on the 30th of November. ScarletandCooper Tchuts

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2018 06:52AM Jtjjc5 wrote: Hi, Yesterday, I had a stereotactic biopsy for microcalcifications. The biopsy wasn’t bad, just a bit of tenderness today. It will take about a week for the results, I’ve been told the odds as well, but it really isn’t helping with my worrying. I had a TVH 2.5 years ago and the recovery was hard, so the idea of another surgery is weighing in on me as well. Try to relax, as far as the biopsy itself, it really wasn’t bad at all
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy on the 30th of November. ScarletandCooper Tchuts

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2018 07:49AM Jtjjc5 wrote: I just came from the surgeons office. I was given a choice between watch and wait, or lumpectomy and 5 week’s of radiation. I chose the latter. I’m feeling good about the decision. The anxiety of watching and waiting would be too much.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy on the 30th of November. ScarletandCooper Tchuts

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2018 09:07AM Jtjjc5 wrote: Hi, an update on my biopsy, it did come back as DCIS, while it’s not the news I wanted to hear, it could have been worse. My sister had the same diagnosis (several years ago) and has been very reassuring.
